interview_questions.question: What is the `<head>` element used for in an HTML document?
interview_questions.answer: The `<head>` element contains meta-information about the HTML document, such as the title, character encoding, linked CSS files, scripts, and other metadata that is not displayed directly on the page.
interview_questions.explanation: Everything inside `<head>` helps browsers and search engines process and render the page correctly, but does not appear as content to the user.

interview_questions.question: What does the `<title>` tag do and where should it be placed?
interview_questions.answer: The `<title>` tag specifies the title of the HTML document. It should be placed inside the `<head>` section.
interview_questions.explanation: The title appears in the browser tab and is important for SEO and accessibility.

interview_questions.question: How do you set the character encoding for an HTML document?
interview_questions.answer: You set the character encoding using a `<meta charset="UTF-8">` tag inside the `<head>` section.
interview_questions.explanation: UTF-8 is the most common encoding and supports most characters and languages.

interview_questions.question: How do you add a description and author to your HTML page for search engines?
interview_questions.answer:
Use `<meta>` tags inside the `<head>` section:

```html
<meta name="description" content="A sample web page.">
<meta name="author" content="John Doe">
```
interview_questions.explanation: Meta tags provide information for search engines and browsers, but are not shown to users.

interview_questions.question: How do you link an external CSS file in HTML?
interview_questions.answer:
Use the `<link>` tag inside the `<head>` section:

```html
<link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.css">
```
interview_questions.explanation: `<link>` tags are used to link external resources like stylesheets. The `rel` attribute defines the relationship.

interview_questions.question: How do you include a favicon in your HTML page?
interview_questions.answer:
Add this line inside `<head>`:

```html
<link rel="icon" href="favicon.ico" type="image/x-icon">
```
interview_questions.explanation: The favicon is the small icon shown in browser tabs and bookmarks.

interview_questions.question: How do you link to an external JavaScript file in HTML?
interview_questions.answer: Use the `<script src="script.js"></script>` tag, typically placed at the end of `<body>` but can also be in `<head>` with the `defer` or `async` attribute.
interview_questions.explanation: `defer` and `async` control when the script loads relative to HTML parsing.

interview_questions.question: What is the viewport meta tag and why is it important for responsive design?
interview_questions.answer:
The viewport meta tag controls layout on mobile browsers. Example:

```html
<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
```
interview_questions.explanation: Without this tag, mobile browsers may render pages at desktop width, making them hard to read on small screens.

interview_questions.question: How do you prevent search engines from indexing a page?
interview_questions.answer:
Add this meta tag in the `<head>`:

```html
<meta name="robots" content="noindex">
```
interview_questions.explanation: This tells search engines not to include the page in their index, although some crawlers may ignore it.

interview_questions.question: How can you specify keywords for a web page?
interview_questions.answer:
Use the keywords meta tag inside `<head>`:

```html
<meta name="keywords" content="HTML, web, coding, tutorial">
```
interview_questions.explanation: This tag used to help with SEO, but most modern search engines do not use it for ranking anymore.
